title: Modified Sequential Organ Failure Assessment (mSOFA) Score
description: Predicts ICU mortality using mostly clinical variables and fewer labs compared to the original SOFA Score. Designed for resource-constrained critical care environments during disasters or pandemics.

parameters.name: scleral_icterus
parameters.description: Presence of scleral icterus or jaundice

ranges.interpretation: Low mortality risk with good prognosis in ICU setting.
Moderate mortality risk requiring intensive monitoring and aggressive treatment.
High mortality risk requiring maximum intensive care support and consideration of goals of care.

references: Rahmatinejad Z, Reihani H, Tohidinezhad F, Rahmatinejad F, Pourmand A, Abu-Hanna A, et al. Prognostic utilization of models based on the SOFA score and red cell distribution width in intensive care unit patients. Am J Emerg Med. 2018;36(5):775-781. doi: 10.1016/j.ajem.2017.10.011.

Grissom CK, Brown SM, Kuttler KG, Boltax JP, Jones J, Jephson AR, et al. A modified sequential organ failure assessment score for critical care triage. Disaster Med Public Health Prep. 2010;4(4):277-84. doi: 10.1001/dmp.2010.40.

Vahedian-Azimi A, Keramatinia AA, Bashar FR, Hajiesmaeili MR, Shojaei S, Hatamian S, et al. Comparison of proposed modified and original sequential organ failure assessment scores in predicting ICU mortality: a prospective, observational, follow-up study. Turk J Anaesthesiol Reanim. 2017;45(1):16-22. doi: 10.5152/TJAR.2017.93798.
formula: mSOFA Score = Respiratory (SpO₂/FiO₂) + Liver (Scleral Icterus) + Cardiovascular (MAP + Vasopressors) + CNS (GCS) + Renal (Creatinine). Range: 0-20 points.
notes: Simplified version of SOFA score requiring fewer laboratory tests
Particularly useful in resource-constrained critical care environments
Predicts ICU mortality with similar accuracy to the original SOFA score
Eliminates the hepatic component from original SOFA (uses scleral icterus instead of bilirubin)
Score ranges from 0-20 instead of 0-24 (original SOFA)
Day 1 mSOFA scores perform equally well as SOFA with AUC of 0.84
Threshold of 9 provides 85.6% sensitivity and 74.6% specificity for mortality prediction
